page.title: 02 GASCOIGNE WOOD COAL MINE
page.content: Gascoigne Wood coal mine is situated on the North West corner of our grid. It got its name from the Gascoigne family who owned the land, which was a wood.It was built in 1978 at a cost of 1.3 billion pounds but they won't have completely finished it until 1989. It was opened by the Duchess of Kent and it is hoped that it will be re-opened in 1989 by the Queen.They employ 150 workers, who earn 160-170 pounds a week. There are 3 shifts worked,each about 6-7 hours long.The miners under ground have to take special safety precautions.They wear brightly coloured overalls to be easily seen, safety helmets with a light on the front which works by a battery, clipped to their belt.They also have self rescuers, this device is used if gas is around.It gives the miner half an hour to find fresh air.
